lead_paragraph: The new reports also show that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo received $900,000 from limited-liability companies, whose influence he is now trying to curb.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and VIVIAN YEE

snippet: The new reports also show that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo received $900,000 from limited-liability companies, whose influence he is now trying to curb.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Top Political Advisers Got $500,000 in 6 Months, Records Say
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Top Political Advisers Got $500,000 in 6 Months, Reports Say

abstract: Financial records show New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio’s top political consultants were paid about $500,000 over six months by mayor’s campaign fund and nonprofit group Campaign for One New York, created to advance his agenda; de Blasio's use of outside nonprofits has been criticized by government watchdogs and in past by de Blasio himself, who has since stated he will use them to play on equal footing with opponents.
